content: Who was the artist behind the world-renowned painting 'The Starry Night'?

Ah, 'The Starry Night'—such a breathtaking masterpiece! It was created by the incredibly talented Dutch painter Vincent van Gogh. He painted it in 1889 while he was staying at an asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, France. This iconic work is now housed at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. Van Gogh's use of swirling patterns and vibrant colors in 'The Starry Night' has made it one of the most recognized and beloved paintings in the world.
